poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Business class is brilliant. It's like being in a pram. Toddle up to the front of the queue, you get tucked in. A lady checks your buckle's fastened. Just like your mum She gives you sweeties, she gives you toys. If you frown she knows your name, she says what's wrong? I never travelled first. Must be even better: The total prenatal experience, warm Snug to yourself. Get what you want before you even think.
